summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To know wisdom and instruction,
    to understand words of insight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to receive instruction in wise dealing,
    in righteousness, justice, and equity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give prudence to the simple,
    knowledge and discretion to the youth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wise hear and increase in learning,
    and the one who understands obtain guidance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to understand a proverb and a saying,
    the words of the wise and their riddles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge;
    fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, your father's instruction,
    and forsake not your mother's teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they are a graceful garland for your head
    and pendants for your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if sinners entice you,
    do not consent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood;
    let us ambush the innocent without reason;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
like Sheol let us swallow them alive,
    and whole, like those who go down to the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
we shall find all precious goods,
    we shall fill our houses with plunder;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
throw in your lot among us;
    we will all have one purse”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my son, do not walk in the way with them;
    hold back your foot from their paths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their feet run to evil,
    and they make haste to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in vain is a net spread
    in the sight of any bird,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but these men lie in wait for their own blood;
    they set an ambush for their own lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain;
    it takes away the life of its possessors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom cries aloud in the street,
    in the markets she raises her voice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
at the head of the noisy streets she cries out;
    at the entrance of the city gates she speaks:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long, O simple ones, will you love being simple?
How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing
    and fools hate knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because I have called and you refused to listen,
    have stretched out my hand and no one has heeded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you have ignored all my counsel
    and would have none of my reproof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also will laugh at your calamity;
    I will mock when terror strikes you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when terror strikes you like a storm
    and your calamity comes like a whirlwind,
    when distress and anguish come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they will call upon me, but I will not answer;
    they will seek me diligently but will not find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they hated knowledge
    and did not choose the fear of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
would have none of my counsel
    and despised all my reproof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way,
    and have their fill of their own devices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the simple are killed by their turning away,
    and the complacency of fools destroys them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but whoever listens to me will dwell secure
    and will be at ease, without dread of disaster.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you receive my words
    and treasure up my commandments with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
making your ear attentive to wisdom
    and inclining your heart to understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yes, if you call out for insight
    and raise your voice for understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if you seek it like silver
    and search for it as for hidden treasures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then you will understand the fear of the Lord
    and find the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord gives wisdom;
    from his mouth come knowledge and understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he stores up sound wisdom for the upright;
    he is a shield to those who walk in integrity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
guarding the paths of justice
    and watching over the way of his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will understand righteousness and justice
    and equity, every good path;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for wisdom will come into your heart,
    and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
discretion will watch over you,
    understanding will guard you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
delivering you from the way of evil,
    from men of perverted speech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who forsake the paths of uprightness
    to walk in the ways of darkness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who rejoice in doing evil
    and delight in the perverseness of evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
men whose paths are crooked,
    and who are devious in their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So you will be delivered from the forbidden woman,
    from the adulteress with her smooth words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who forsakes the companion of her youth
    and forgets the covenant of her God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for her house sinks down to death,
    and her paths to the departed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
none who go to her come back,
    nor do they regain the paths of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So you will walk in the way of the good
    and keep to the paths of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the upright will inhabit the land,
    and those with integrity will remain in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the wicked will be cut off from the land,
    and the treacherous will be rooted out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
    but let your heart keep my commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for length of days and years of life
    and peace they will add to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So you will find favor and good success
    in the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not wise in your own eyes;
    fear the Lord, and turn away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be healing to your flesh
    and refreshment to your bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor the Lord with your wealth
    and with the firstfruits of all your produce;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then your barns will be filled with plenty,
    and your vats will be bursting with wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not despise the Lord's discipline
    or be weary of his reproof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord reproves him whom he loves,
    as a father the son in whom he delights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one who finds wisdom,
    and the one who gets understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the gain from her is better than gain from silver
    and her profit better than gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is more precious than jewels,
    and nothing you desire can compare with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long life is in her right hand;
    in her left hand are riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
    and all her paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her;
    those who hold her fast are called blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord by wisdom founded the earth;
    by understanding he established the heavens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by his knowledge the deeps broke open,
    and the clouds drop down the dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not lose sight of these—
    keep sound wisdom and discretion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they will be life for your soul
    and adornment for your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will walk on your way securely,
    and your foot will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you lie down, you will not be afraid;
    when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid of sudden terror
    or of the ruin of the wicked, when it comes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord will be your confidence
    and will keep your foot from being caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,
    when it is in your power to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again,
    tomorrow I will give it”—when you have it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not plan evil against your neighbor,
    who dwells trustingly beside you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not contend with a man for no reason,
    when he has done you no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not envy a man of violence
    and do not choose any of his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the devious person is an abomination to the Lord,
    but the upright are in his confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord's curse is on the house of the wicked,
    but he blesses the dwelling of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Toward the scorners he is scornful,
    but to the humble he gives favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise will inherit honor,
    but fools get disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O sons, a father's instruction,
    and be attentive, that you may gain insight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for I give you good precepts;
    do not forsake my teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I was a son with my father,
    tender, the only one in the sight of my mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Get wisdom; get insight;
    do not forget, and do not turn away from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forsake her, and she will keep you;
    love her, and she will guard you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom,
    and whatever you get, get insight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prize her highly, and she will exalt you;
    she will honor you if you embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will place on your head a graceful garland;
    she will bestow on you a beautiful crown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, and accept my words,
    that the years of your life may be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have taught you the way of wisdom;
    I have led you in the paths of uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk, your step will not be hampered,
    and if you run, you will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep hold of instruction; do not let go;
    guard her, for she is your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not enter the path of the wicked,
    and do not walk in the way of the evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoid it; do not go on it;
    turn away from it and pass on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong;
    they are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they eat the bread of wickedness
    and drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn,
    which shines brighter and brighter until full day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is like deep darkness;
    they do not know over what they stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, be attentive to my words;
    incline your ear to my sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them not escape from your sight;
    keep them within your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they are life to those who find them,
    and healing to all their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your heart with all vigilance,
    for from it flow the springs of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put away from you crooked speech,
    and put devious talk far from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your eyes look directly forward,
    and your gaze be straight before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ponder the path of your feet;
    then all your ways will be sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not swerve to the right or to the left;
    turn your foot away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, be attentive to my wisdom;
    incline your ear to my understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you may keep discretion,
    and your lips may guard knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey,
    and her speech is smoother than oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but in the end she is bitter as wormwood,
    sharp as a two-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her feet go down to death;
    her steps follow the path to Sheol;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
she does not ponder the path of life;
    her ways wander, and she does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now, O sons, listen to me,
    and do not depart from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your way far from her,
    and do not go near the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest you give your honor to others
    and your years to the merciless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest strangers take their fill of your strength,
    and your labors go to the house of a foreigner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and at the end of your life you groan,
    when your flesh and body are consumed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and you say, “How I hated discipline,
    and my heart despised reproof!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not listen to the voice of my teachers
    or incline my ear to my instructors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am at the brink of utter ruin
    in the assembled congregation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drink water from your own cistern,
    flowing water from your own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should your springs be scattered abroad,
    streams of water in the streets?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be for yourself alone,
    and not for strangers with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your fountain be blessed,
    and rejoice in the wife of your youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you be intoxicated, my son, with a forbidden woman
    and embrace the bosom of an adulteress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a man's ways are before the eyes of the Lord,
    and he ponders all his paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The iniquities of the wicked ensnare him,
    and he is held fast in the cords of his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He dies for lack of discipline,
    and because of his great folly he is led astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor,
    have given your pledge for a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if you are snared in the words of your mouth,
    caught in the words of your mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give your eyes no sleep
    and your eyelids no slumber;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,
    like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without having any chief,
    officer, or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
she prepares her bread in summer
    and gathers her food in harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you lie there, O sluggard?
    When will you arise from your sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
    and want like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless person, a wicked man,
    goes about with crooked speech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
winks with his eyes, signals with his feet,
    points with his finger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with perverted heart devises evil,
    continually sowing discord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly;
    in a moment he will be broken beyond healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are six things that the Lord hates,
    seven that are an abomination to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
    and hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a heart that devises wicked plans,
    feet that make haste to run to evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a false witness who breathes out lies,
    and one who sows discord among brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep your father's commandment,
    and forsake not your mother's teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them on your heart always;
    tie them around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light,
    and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to preserve you from the evil woman,
    from the smooth tongue of the adulteress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not desire her beauty in your heart,
    and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the price of a prostitute is only a loaf of bread,
    but a married woman hunts down a precious life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man carry fire next to his chest
    and his clothes not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or can one walk on hot coals
    and his feet not be scorched?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife;
    none who touches her will go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People do not despise a thief if he steals
    to satisfy his appetite when he is hungry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but if he is caught, he will pay sevenfold;
    he will give all the goods of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who commits adultery lacks sense;
    he who does it destroys himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will get wounds and dishonor,
    and his disgrace will not be wiped away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For jealousy makes a man furious,
    and he will not spare when he takes revenge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will accept no compensation;
    he will refuse though you multiply gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep my words
    and treasure up my commandments with you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
keep my commandments and live;
    keep my teaching as the apple of your eye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
bind them on your fingers;
    write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
    and call insight your intimate friend,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to keep you from the forbidden woman,
    from the adulteress with her smooth words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For at the window of my house
    I have looked out through my lattice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and I have seen among the simple,
    I have perceived among the youths,
    a young man lacking sense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
passing along the street near her corner,
    taking the road to her house
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the twilight, in the evening,
    at the time of night and darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And behold, the woman meets him,
    dressed as a prostitute, wily of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is loud and wayward;
    her feet do not stay at home;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
now in the street, now in the market,
    and at every corner she lies in wait.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She seizes him and kisses him,
    and with bold face she says to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I had to offer sacrifices,
    and today I have paid my vows;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so now I have come out to meet you,
    to seek you eagerly, and I have found you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have spread my couch with coverings,
    colored linens from Egyptian linen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have perfumed my bed with myrrh,
    aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us take our fill of love till morning;
    let us delight ourselves with love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my husband is not at home;
    he has gone on a long journey;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he took a bag of money with him;
    at full moon he will come home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With much seductive speech she persuades him;
    with her smooth talk she compels him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All at once he follows her,
    as an ox goes to the slaughter,
or as a stag is caught fast
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And now, O sons, listen to me,
    and be attentive to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let not your heart turn aside to her ways;
    do not stray into her paths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for many a victim has she laid low,
    and all her slain are a mighty throng.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her house is the way to Sheol,
    going down to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does not wisdom call?
    Does not understanding raise her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the heights beside the way,
    at the crossroads she takes her stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
beside the gates in front of the town,
    at the entrance of the portals she cries aloud:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To you, O men, I call,
    and my cry is to the children of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O simple ones, learn prudence;
    O fools, learn sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, for I will speak noble things,
    and from my lips will come what is right,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for my mouth will utter truth;
    wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the words of my mouth are righteous;
    there is nothing twisted or crooked in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all straight to him who understands,
    and right to those who find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take my instruction instead of silver,
    and knowledge rather than choice gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for wisdom is better than jewels,
    and all that you may desire cannot compare with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, wisdom, dwell with prudence,
    and I find knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is hatred of evil.
Pride and arrogance and the way of evil
    and perverted speech I hate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have counsel and sound wisdom;
    I have insight; I have strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me kings reign,
    and rulers decree what is just;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by me princes rule,
    and nobles, all who govern justly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love those who love me,
    and those who seek me diligently find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches and honor are with me,
    enduring wealth and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold,
    and my yield than choice silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I walk in the way of righteousness,
    in the paths of justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
granting an inheritance to those who love me,
    and filling their treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord possessed me at the beginning of his work,
    the first of his acts of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ages ago I was set up,
    at the first, before the beginning of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there were no depths I was brought forth,
    when there were no springs abounding with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains had been shaped,
    before the hills, I was brought forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before he had made the earth with its fields,
    or the first of the dust of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he established the heavens, I was there;
    when he drew a circle on the face of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he made firm the skies above,
    when he established the fountains of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he assigned to the sea its limit,
    so that the waters might not transgress his command,
when he marked out the foundations of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then I was beside him, like a master workman,
and I was daily his delight,
    rejoicing before him always,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
rejoicing in his inhabited world
    and delighting in the children of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And now, O sons, listen to me:
    blessed are those who keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear instruction and be wise,
    and do not neglect it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one who listens to me,
    watching daily at my gates,
    waiting beside my doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For whoever finds me finds life
    and obtains favor from the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but he who fails to find me injures himself;
    all who hate me love death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom has built her house;
    she has hewn her seven pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has slaughtered her beasts; she has mixed her wine;
    she has also set her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has sent out her young women to call
    from the highest places in the town,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”
    To him who lacks sense she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come, eat of my bread
    and drink of the wine I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave your simple ways, and live,
    and walk in the way of insight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever corrects a scoffer gets himself abuse,
    and he who reproves a wicked man incurs injury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not reprove a scoffer, or he will hate you;
    reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser;
    teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
    and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by me your days will be multiplied,
    and years will be added to your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself;
    if you scoff, you alone will bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman Folly is loud;
    she is seductive and knows nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She sits at the door of her house;
    she takes a seat on the highest places of the town,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
calling to those who pass by,
    who are going straight on their way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”
    And to him who lacks sense she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stolen water is sweet,
    and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he does not know that the dead are there,
    that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proverbs of Solomon.
A wise son makes a glad father,
    but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Treasures gained by wickedness do not profit,
    but righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord does not let the righteous go hungry,
    but he thwarts the craving of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A slack hand causes poverty,
    but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gathers in summer is a prudent son,
    but he who sleeps in harvest is a son who brings shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings are on the head of the righteous,
    but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The memory of the righteous is a blessing,
    but the name of the wicked will rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise of heart will receive commandments,
    but a babbling fool will come to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks in integrity walks securely,
    but he who makes his ways crooked will be found out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever winks the eye causes trouble,
    and a babbling fool will come to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
    but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hatred stirs up strife,
    but love covers all offenses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the lips of him who has understanding, wisdom is found,
    but a rod is for the back of him who lacks sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise lay up knowledge,
    but the mouth of a fool brings ruin near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich man's wealth is his strong city;
    the poverty of the poor is their ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wage of the righteous leads to life,
    the gain of the wicked to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life,
    but he who rejects reproof leads others astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who conceals hatred has lying lips,
    and whoever utters slander is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
    but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver;
    the heart of the wicked is of little worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous feed many,
    but fools die for lack of sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of the Lord makes rich,
    and he adds no sorrow with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doing wrong is like a joke to a fool,
    but wisdom is pleasure to a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What the wicked dreads will come upon him,
    but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the tempest passes, the wicked is no more,
    but the righteous is established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
    so is the sluggard to those who send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord prolongs life,
    but the years of the wicked will be short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hope of the righteous brings joy,
    but the expectation of the wicked will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the Lord is a stronghold to the blameless,
    but destruction to evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will never be removed,
    but the wicked will not dwell in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,
    but the perverse tongue will be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,
    but the mouth of the wicked, what is perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false balance is an abomination to the Lord,
    but a just weight is his delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When pride comes, then comes disgrace,
    but with the humble is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The integrity of the upright guides them,
    but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches do not profit in the day of wrath,
    but righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the blameless keeps his way straight,
    but the wicked falls by his own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the upright delivers them,
    but the treacherous are taken captive by their lust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked dies, his hope will perish,
    and the expectation of wealth perishes too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous is delivered from trouble,
    and the wicked walks into it instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With his mouth the godless man would destroy his neighbor,
    but by knowledge the righteous are delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices,
    and when the wicked perish there are shouts of gladness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted,
    but by the mouth of the wicked it is overthrown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever belittles his neighbor lacks sense,
    but a man of understanding remains silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever goes about slandering reveals secrets,
    but he who is trustworthy in spirit keeps a thing covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no guidance, a people falls,
    but in an abundance of counselors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer harm,
    but he who hates striking hands in pledge is secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gracious woman gets honor,
    and violent men get riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who is kind benefits himself,
    but a cruel man hurts himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked earns deceptive wages,
    but one who sows righteousness gets a sure reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is steadfast in righteousness will live,
    but he who pursues evil will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those of crooked heart are an abomination to the Lord,
    but those of blameless ways are his delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be assured, an evil person will not go unpunished,
    but the offspring of the righteous will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a gold ring in a pig's snout
    is a beautiful woman without discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the righteous ends only in good,
    the expectation of the wicked in wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One gives freely, yet grows all the richer;
    another withholds what he should give, and only suffers want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever brings blessing will be enriched,
    and one who waters will himself be watered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people curse him who holds back grain,
    but a blessing is on the head of him who sells it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever diligently seeks good seeks favor,
    but evil comes to him who searches for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever trusts in his riches will fall,
    but the righteous will flourish like a green leaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever troubles his own household will inherit the wind,
    and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
    and whoever captures souls is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the righteous is repaid on earth,
    how much more the wicked and the sinner!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,
    but he who hates reproof is stupid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man obtains favor from the Lord,
    but a man of evil devices he condemns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one is established by wickedness,
    but the root of the righteous will never be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An excellent wife is the crown of her husband,
    but she who brings shame is like rottenness in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the righteous are just;
    the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood,
    but the mouth of the upright delivers them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are overthrown and are no more,
    but the house of the righteous will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man is commended according to his good sense,
    but one of twisted mind is despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be lowly and have a servant
    than to play the great man and lack bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is righteous has regard for the life of his beast,
    but the mercy of the wicked is cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever works his land will have plenty of bread,
    but he who follows worthless pursuits lacks sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is wicked covets the spoil of evildoers,
    but the root of the righteous bears fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil man is ensnared by the transgression of his lips,
    but the righteous escapes from trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of his mouth a man is satisfied with good,
    and the work of a man's hand comes back to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
    but a wise man listens to advice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The vexation of a fool is known at once,
    but the prudent ignores an insult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever speaks the truth gives honest evidence,
    but a false witness utters deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
    but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truthful lips endure forever,
    but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil,
    but those who plan peace have joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No ill befalls the righteous,
    but the wicked are filled with trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord,
    but those who act faithfully are his delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man conceals knowledge,
    but the heart of fools proclaims folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hand of the diligent will rule,
    while the slothful will be put to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anxiety in a man's heart weighs him down,
    but a good word makes him glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who is righteous is a guide to his neighbor,
    but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is slothful will not roast his game,
    but the diligent man will get precious wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the path of righteousness is life,
    and in its pathway there is no death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son hears his father's instruction,
    but a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of his mouth a man eats what is good,
    but the desire of the treacherous is for violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever guards his mouth preserves his life;
    he who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
    while the soul of the diligent is richly supplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous hates falsehood,
    but the wicked brings shame and disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness guards him whose way is blameless,
    but sin overthrows the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One pretends to be rich, yet has nothing;
    another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ransom of a man's life is his wealth,
    but a poor man hears no threat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the righteous rejoices,
    but the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By insolence comes nothing but strife,
    but with those who take advice is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,
    but whoever gathers little by little will increase it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
    but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever despises the word brings destruction on himself,
    but he who reveres the commandment will be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
    that one may turn away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good sense wins favor,
    but the way of the treacherous is their ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every prudent man acts with knowledge,
    but a fool flaunts his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
    but a faithful envoy brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Poverty and disgrace come to him who ignores instruction,
    but whoever heeds reproof is honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul,
    but to turn away from evil is an abomination to fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,
    but the companion of fools will suffer harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Disaster pursues sinners,
    but the righteous are rewarded with good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children,
    but the sinner's wealth is laid up for the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fallow ground of the poor would yield much food,
    but it is swept away through injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever spares the rod hates his son,
    but he who loves him is diligent to discipline him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous has enough to satisfy his appetite,
    but the belly of the wicked suffers want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisest of women builds her house,
    but folly with her own hands tears it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks in uprightness fears the Lord,
    but he who is devious in his ways despises him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,
    but the lips of the wise will preserve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there are no oxen, the manger is clean,
    but abundant crops come by the strength of the ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful witness does not lie,
    but a false witness breathes out lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer seeks wisdom in vain,
    but knowledge is easy for a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave the presence of a fool,
    for there you do not meet words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way,
    but the folly of fools is deceiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools mock at the guilt offering,
    but the upright enjoy acceptance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart knows its own bitterness,
    and no stranger shares its joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
    but the tent of the upright will flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
    but its end is the way to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in laughter the heart may ache,
    and the end of joy may be grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The backslider in heart will be filled with the fruit of his ways,
    and a good man will be filled with the fruit of his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple believes everything,
    but the prudent gives thought to his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who is wise is cautious and turns away from evil,
    but a fool is reckless and careless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of quick temper acts foolishly,
    and a man of evil devices is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple inherit folly,
    but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The evil bow down before the good,
    the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor is disliked even by his neighbor,
    but the rich has many friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever despises his neighbor is a sinner,
    but blessed is he who is generous to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do they not go astray who devise evil?
    Those who devise good meet steadfast love and faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all toil there is profit,
    but mere talk tends only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown of the wise is their wealth,
    but the folly of fools brings folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A truthful witness saves lives,
    but one who breathes out lies is deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fear of the Lord one has strong confidence,
    and his children will have a refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,
    that one may turn away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a multitude of people is the glory of a king,
    but without people a prince is ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is slow to anger has great understanding,
    but he who has a hasty temper exalts folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A tranquil heart gives life to the flesh,
    but envy makes the bones rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever oppresses a poor man insults his Maker,
    but he who is generous to the needy honors him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is overthrown through his evildoing,
    but the righteous finds refuge in his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom rests in the heart of a man of understanding,
    but it makes itself known even in the midst of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness exalts a nation,
    but sin is a reproach to any people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A servant who deals wisely has the king's favor,
    but his wrath falls on one who acts shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the wise commends knowledge,
    but the mouths of fools pour out folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
    keeping watch on the evil and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gentle tongue is a tree of life,
    but perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool despises his father's instruction,
    but whoever heeds reproof is prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the house of the righteous there is much treasure,
    but trouble befalls the income of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the wise spread knowledge;
    not so the hearts of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
    but the prayer of the upright is acceptable to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
    but he loves him who pursues righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is severe discipline for him who forsakes the way;
    whoever hates reproof will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol and Abaddon lie open before the Lord;
    how much more the hearts of the children of man!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer does not like to be reproved;
    he will not go to the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A glad heart makes a cheerful face,
    but by sorrow of heart the spirit is crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge,
    but the mouths of fools feed on folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the days of the afflicted are evil,
    but the cheerful of heart has a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with the fear of the Lord
    than great treasure and trouble with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dinner of herbs where love is
    than a fattened ox and hatred with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hot-tempered man stirs up strife,
    but he who is slow to anger quiets contention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a sluggard is like a hedge of thorns,
    but the path of the upright is a level highway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son makes a glad father,
    but a foolish man despises his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is a joy to him who lacks sense,
    but a man of understanding walks straight ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without counsel plans fail,
    but with many advisers they succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To make an apt answer is a joy to a man,
    and a word in season, how good it is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The path of life leads upward for the prudent,
    that he may turn away from Sheol beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord tears down the house of the proud
    but maintains the widow's boundaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord,
    but gracious words are pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is greedy for unjust gain troubles his own household,
    but he who hates bribes will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the righteous ponders how to answer,
    but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is far from the wicked,
    but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the eyes rejoices the heart,
    and good news refreshes the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ear that listens to life-giving reproof
    will dwell among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever ignores instruction despises himself,
    but he who listens to reproof gains intelligence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is instruction in wisdom,
    and humility comes before honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the heart belong to man,
    but the answer of the tongue is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes,
    but the Lord weighs the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your work to the Lord,
    and your plans will be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made everything for its purpose,
    even the wicked for the day of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone who is arrogant in heart is an abomination to the Lord;
    be assured, he will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By steadfast love and faithfulness iniquity is atoned for,
    and by the fear of the Lord one turns away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a man's ways please the Lord,
    he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with righteousness
    than great revenues with injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of man plans his way,
    but the Lord establishes his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An oracle is on the lips of a king;
    his mouth does not sin in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A just balance and scales are the Lord's;
    all the weights in the bag are his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is an abomination to kings to do evil,
    for the throne is established by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous lips are the delight of a king,
    and he loves him who speaks what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king's wrath is a messenger of death,
    and a wise man will appease it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the light of a king's face there is life,
    and his favor is like the clouds that bring the spring rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much better to get wisdom than gold!
    To get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highway of the upright turns aside from evil;
    whoever guards his way preserves his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pride goes before destruction,
    and a haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor
    than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gives thought to the word will discover good,
    and blessed is he who trusts in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise of heart is called discerning,
    and sweetness of speech increases persuasiveness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good sense is a fountain of life to him who has it,
    but the instruction of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the wise makes his speech judicious
    and adds persuasiveness to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gracious words are like a honeycomb,
    sweetness to the soul and health to the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
    but its end is the way to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worker's appetite works for him;
    his mouth urges him on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless man plots evil,
    and his speech is like a scorching fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A dishonest man spreads strife,
    and a whisperer separates close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of violence entices his neighbor
    and leads him in a way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever winks his eyes plans dishonest things;
    he who purses his lips brings evil to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gray hair is a crown of glory;
    it is gained in a righteous life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty,
    and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot is cast into the lap,
    but its every decision is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dry morsel with quiet
    than a house full of feasting with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully
    and will share the inheritance as one of the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crucible is for silver, and the furnace is for gold,
    and the Lord tests hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evildoer listens to wicked lips,
    and a liar gives ear to a mischievous tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever mocks the poor insults his Maker;
    he who is glad at calamity will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grandchildren are the crown of the aged,
    and the glory of children is their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fine speech is not becoming to a fool;
    still less is false speech to a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A bribe is like a magic stone in the eyes of the one who gives it;
    wherever he turns he prospers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever covers an offense seeks love,
    but he who repeats a matter separates close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rebuke goes deeper into a man of understanding
    than a hundred blows into a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil man seeks only rebellion,
    and a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a man meet a she-bear robbed of her cubs
    rather than a fool in his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If anyone returns evil for good,
    evil will not depart from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of strife is like letting out water,
    so quit before the quarrel breaks out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who justifies the wicked and he who condemns the righteous
    are both alike an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should a fool have money in his hand to buy wisdom
    when he has no sense?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A friend loves at all times,
    and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who lacks sense gives a pledge
    and puts up security in the presence of his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves transgression loves strife;
    he who makes his door high seeks destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of crooked heart does not discover good,
    and one with a dishonest tongue falls into calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sires a fool gets himself sorrow,
    and the father of a fool has no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A joyful heart is good medicine,
    but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked accepts a bribe in secret
    to pervert the ways of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The discerning sets his face toward wisdom,
    but the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is a grief to his father
    and bitterness to her who bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To impose a fine on a righteous man is not good,
    nor to strike the noble for their uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever restrains his words has knowledge,
    and he who has a cool spirit is a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise;
    when he closes his lips, he is deemed intelligent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever isolates himself seeks his own desire;
    he breaks out against all sound judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool takes no pleasure in understanding,
    but only in expressing his opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When wickedness comes, contempt comes also,
    and with dishonor comes disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a man's mouth are deep waters;
    the fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to be partial to the wicked
    or to deprive the righteous of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool's lips walk into a fight,
    and his mouth invites a beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool's mouth is his ruin,
    and his lips are a snare to his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels;
    they go down into the inner parts of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is slack in his work
    is a brother to him who destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower;
    the righteous man runs into it and is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich man's wealth is his strong city,
    and like a high wall in his imagination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before destruction a man's heart is haughty,
    but humility comes before honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one gives an answer before he hears,
    it is his folly and shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man's spirit will endure sickness,
    but a crushed spirit who can bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An intelligent heart acquires knowledge,
    and the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man's gift makes room for him
    and brings him before the great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who states his case first seems right,
    until the other comes and examines him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot puts an end to quarrels
    and decides between powerful contenders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brother offended is more unyielding than a strong city,
    and quarreling is like the bars of a castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of a man's mouth his stomach is satisfied;
    he is satisfied by the yield of his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who finds a wife finds a good thing
    and obtains favor from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor use entreaties,
    but the rich answer roughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of many companions may come to ruin,
    but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity
    than one who is crooked in speech and is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Desire without knowledge is not good,
    and whoever makes haste with his feet misses his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a man's folly brings his way to ruin,
    his heart rages against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth brings many new friends,
    but a poor man is deserted by his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
    and he who breathes out lies will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many seek the favor of a generous man,
    and everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gets sense loves his own soul;
    he who keeps understanding will discover good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
    and he who breathes out lies will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury,
    much less for a slave to rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good sense makes one slow to anger,
    and it is his glory to overlook an offense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king's wrath is like the growling of a lion,
    but his favor is like dew on the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is ruin to his father,
    and a wife's quarreling is a continual dripping of rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
House and wealth are inherited from fathers,
    but a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep,
    and an idle person will suffer hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever keeps the commandment keeps his life;
    he who despises his ways will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is generous to the poor lends to the Lord,
    and he will repay him for his deed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discipline your son, for there is hope;
    do not set your heart on putting him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of great wrath will pay the penalty,
    for if you deliver him, you will only have to do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to advice and accept instruction,
    that you may gain wisdom in the future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the plans in the mind of a man,
    but it is the purpose of the Lord that will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is desired in a man is steadfast love,
    and a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard buries his hand in the dish
    and will not even bring it back to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strike a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence;
    reprove a man of understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who does violence to his father and chases away his mother
    is a son who brings shame and reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cease to hear instruction, my son,
    and you will stray from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless witness mocks at justice,
    and the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Condemnation is ready for scoffers,
    and beating for the backs of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler,
    and whoever is led astray by it is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The terror of a king is like the growling of a lion;
    whoever provokes him to anger forfeits his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife,
    but every fool will be quarreling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard does not plow in the autumn;
    he will seek at harvest and have nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The purpose in a man's heart is like deep water,
    but a man of understanding will draw it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many a man proclaims his own steadfast love,
    but a faithful man who can find?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous who walks in his integrity—
    blessed are his children after him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king who sits on the throne of judgment
    winnows all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can say, “I have made my heart pure;
    I am clean from my sin”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unequal weights and unequal measures
    are both alike an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a child makes himself known by his acts,
    by whether his conduct is pure and upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hearing ear and the seeing eye,
    the Lord has made them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Love not sleep, lest you come to poverty;
    open your eyes, and you will have plenty of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Bad, bad,” says the buyer,
    but when he goes away, then he boasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is gold and abundance of costly stones,
    but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take a man's garment when he has put up security for a stranger,
    and hold it in pledge when he puts up security for foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man,
    but afterward his mouth will be full of gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plans are established by counsel;
    by wise guidance wage war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever goes about slandering reveals secrets;
    therefore do not associate with a simple babbler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one curses his father or his mother,
    his lamp will be put out in utter darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance gained hastily in the beginning
    will not be blessed in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I will repay evil”;
    wait for the Lord, and he will deliver you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unequal weights are an abomination to the Lord,
    and false scales are not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man's steps are from the Lord;
    how then can man understand his way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a snare to say rashly, “It is holy,”
    and to reflect only after making vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise king winnows the wicked
    and drives the wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord,
    searching all his innermost parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Steadfast love and faithfulness preserve the king,
    and by steadfast love his throne is upheld.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The glory of young men is their strength,
    but the splendor of old men is their gray hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blows that wound cleanse away evil;
    strokes make clean the innermost parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king's heart is a stream of water in the hand of the Lord;
    he turns it wherever he will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every way of a man is right in his own eyes,
    but the Lord weighs the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do righteousness and justice
    is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haughty eyes and a proud heart,
    the lamp of the wicked, are sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the diligent lead surely to abundance,
    but everyone who is hasty comes only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue
    is a fleeting vapor and a snare of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,
    because they refuse to do what is just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the guilty is crooked,
    but the conduct of the pure is upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to live in a corner of the housetop
    than in a house shared with a quarrelsome wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the wicked desires evil;
    his neighbor finds no mercy in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a scoffer is punished, the simple becomes wise;
    when a wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked;
    he throws the wicked down to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever closes his ear to the cry of the poor
    will himself call out and not be answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift in secret averts anger,
    and a concealed bribe, strong wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When justice is done, it is a joy to the righteous
    but terror to evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who wanders from the way of good sense
    will rest in the assembly of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves pleasure will be a poor man;
    he who loves wine and oil will not be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is a ransom for the righteous,
    and the traitor for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to live in a desert land
    than with a quarrelsome and fretful woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Precious treasure and oil are in a wise man's dwelling,
    but a foolish man devours it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever pursues righteousness and kindness
    will find life, righteousness, and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man scales the city of the mighty
    and brings down the stronghold in which they trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue
    keeps himself out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Scoffer” is the name of the arrogant, haughty man
    who acts with arrogant pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the sluggard kills him,
    for his hands refuse to labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long he craves and craves,
    but the righteous gives and does not hold back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;
    how much more when he brings it with evil intent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will perish,
    but the word of a man who hears will endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man puts on a bold face,
    but the upright gives thought to his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No wisdom, no understanding, no counsel
    can avail against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horse is made ready for the day of battle,
    but the victory belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good name is to be chosen rather than great riches,
    and favor is better than silver or gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich and the poor meet together;
    the Lord is the Maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prudent sees danger and hides himself,
    but the simple go on and suffer for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The reward for humility and fear of the Lord
    is riches and honor and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thorns and snares are in the way of the crooked;
    whoever guards his soul will keep far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Train up a child in the way he should go;
    even when he is old he will not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich rules over the poor,
    and the borrower is the slave of the lender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever sows injustice will reap calamity,
    and the rod of his fury will fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever has a bountiful eye will be blessed,
    for he shares his bread with the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drive out a scoffer, and strife will go out,
    and quarreling and abuse will cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves purity of heart,
    and whose speech is gracious, will have the king as his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge,
    but he overthrows the words of the traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard says, “There is a lion outside!
    I shall be killed in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of forbidden women is a deep pit;
    he with whom the Lord is angry will fall into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,
    but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever oppresses the poor to increase his own wealth,
    or gives to the rich, will only come to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise,
    and apply your heart to my knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for it will be pleasant if you keep them within you,
    if all of them are ready on your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That your trust may be in the Lord,
    I have made them known to you today, even to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I not written for you thirty sayings
    of counsel and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to make you know what is right and true,
    that you may give a true answer to those who sent you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rob the poor, because he is poor,
    or crush the afflicted at the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord will plead their cause
    and rob of life those who rob them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make no friendship with a man given to anger,
    nor go with a wrathful man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest you learn his ways
    and entangle yourself in a snare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not one of those who give pledges,
    who put up security for debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have nothing with which to pay,
    why should your bed be taken from under you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not move the ancient landmark
    that your fathers have set.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you sit down to eat with a ruler,
    observe carefully what is before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and put a knife to your throat
    if you are given to appetite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not desire his delicacies,
    for they are deceptive food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not toil to acquire wealth;
    be discerning enough to desist.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not eat the bread of a man who is stingy;
    do not desire his delicacies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he is like one who is inwardly calculating.
    “Eat and drink!” he says to you,
    but his heart is not with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
