You will vomit up the morsels that you have eaten,
    and waste your pleasant words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not speak in the hearing of a fool,
    for he will despise the good sense of your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not move an ancient landmark
    or enter the fields of the fatherless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their Redeemer is strong;
    he will plead their cause against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Apply your heart to instruction
    and your ear to words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold discipline from a child;
    if you strike him with a rod, he will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you strike him with the rod,
    you will save his soul from Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if your heart is wise,
    my heart too will be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My inmost being will exult
    when your lips speak what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let not your heart envy sinners,
    but continue in the fear of the Lord all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely there is a future,
    and your hope will not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, and be wise,
    and direct your heart in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not among drunkards
    or among gluttonous eaters of meat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty,
    and slumber will clothe them with rags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to your father who gave you life,
    and do not despise your mother when she is old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Buy truth, and do not sell it;
    buy wisdom, instruction, and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice;
    he who fathers a wise son will be glad in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your father and mother be glad;
    let her who bore you rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, give me your heart,
    and let your eyes observe my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a prostitute is a deep pit;
    an adulteress is a narrow well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She lies in wait like a robber
    and increases the traitors among mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has woe? Who has sorrow?
    Who has strife? Who has complaining?
Who has wounds without cause?
    Who has redness of eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who tarry long over wine;
    those who go to try mixed wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not look at wine when it is red,
    when it sparkles in the cup
    and goes down smoothly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the end it bites like a serpent
    and stings like an adder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes will see strange things,
    and your heart utter perverse things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be like one who lies down in the midst of the sea,
    like one who lies on the top of a mast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They struck me,” you will say, “but I was not hurt;
    they beat me, but I did not feel it.
When shall I awake?
    I must have another drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not envious of evil men,
    nor desire to be with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their hearts devise violence,
    and their lips talk of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By wisdom a house is built,
    and by understanding it is established;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by knowledge the rooms are filled
    with all precious and pleasant riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man is full of strength,
    and a man of knowledge enhances his might,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for by wise guidance you can wage your war,
    and in abundance of counselors there is victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is too high for a fool;
    in the gate he does not open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever plans to do evil
    will be called a schemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The devising of folly is sin,
    and the scoffer is an abomination to mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you faint in the day of adversity,
    your strength is small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue those who are being taken away to death;
    hold back those who are stumbling to the slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you say, “Behold, we did not know this,”
    does not he who weighs the heart perceive it?
Does not he who keeps watch over your soul know it,
    and will he not repay man according to his work?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, eat honey, for it is good,
    and the drippings of the honeycomb are sweet to your taste.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lie not in wait as a wicked man against the dwelling of the righteous;
    do no violence to his home;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the righteous falls seven times and rises again,
    but the wicked stumble in times of calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rejoice when your enemy falls,
    and let not your heart be glad when he stumbles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest the Lord see it and be displeased,
    and turn away his anger from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fret not yourself because of evildoers,
    and be not envious of the wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the evil man has no future;
    the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, fear the Lord and the king,
    and do not join with those who do otherwise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for disaster will arise suddenly from them,
    and who knows the ruin that will come from them both?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These also are sayings of the wise.
Partiality in judging is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever says to the wicked, “You are in the right,”
    will be cursed by peoples, abhorred by nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but those who rebuke the wicked will have delight,
    and a good blessing will come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gives an honest answer
    kisses the lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be not a witness against your neighbor without cause,
    and do not deceive with your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I will do to him as he has done to me;
    I will pay the man back for what he has done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I passed by the field of a sluggard,
    by the vineyard of a man lacking sense,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I saw and considered it;
    I looked and received instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
    and want like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also are proverbs of Solomon which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is the glory of God to conceal things,
    but the glory of kings is to search things out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth,
    so the heart of kings is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away the dross from the silver,
    and the smith has material for a vessel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
take away the wicked from the presence of the king,
    and his throne will be established in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not put yourself forward in the king's presence
    or stand in the place of the great,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for it is better to be told, “Come up here,”
    than to be put lower in the presence of a noble.
What your eyes have seen
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Argue your case with your neighbor himself,
    and do not reveal another's secret,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest he who hears you bring shame upon you,
    and your ill repute have no end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A word fitly spoken
    is like apples of gold in a setting of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a gold ring or an ornament of gold
    is a wise reprover to a listening ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Like clouds and wind without rain
    is a man who boasts of a gift he does not give.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With patience a ruler may be persuaded,
    and a soft tongue will break a bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have found honey, eat only enough for you,
    lest you have your fill of it and vomit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor's house,
    lest he have his fill of you and hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who bears false witness against his neighbor
    is like a war club, or a sword, or a sharp arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trusting in a treacherous man in time of trouble
    is like a bad tooth or a foot that slips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever sings songs to a heavy heart
    is like one who takes off a garment on a cold day,
    and like vinegar on soda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat,
    and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for you will heap burning coals on his head,
    and the Lord will reward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The north wind brings forth rain,
    and a backbiting tongue, angry looks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to live in a corner of the housetop
    than in a house shared with a quarrelsome wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like cold water to a thirsty soul,
    so is good news from a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a muddied spring or a polluted fountain
    is a righteous man who gives way before the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to eat much honey,
    nor is it glorious to seek one's own glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man without self-control
    is like a city broken into and left without walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like snow in summer or rain in harvest,
    so honor is not fitting for a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a sparrow in its flitting, like a swallow in its flying,
    a curse that is causeless does not alight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A whip for the horse, a bridle for the donkey,
    and a rod for the back of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer not a fool according to his folly,
    lest you be like him yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer a fool according to his folly,
    lest he be wise in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever sends a message by the hand of a fool
    cuts off his own feet and drinks violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a lame man's legs, which hang useless,
    is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like one who binds the stone in the sling
    is one who gives honor to a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a thorn that goes up into the hand of a drunkard
    is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like an archer who wounds everyone
    is one who hires a passing fool or drunkard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a dog that returns to his vomit
    is a fool who repeats his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you see a man who is wise in his own eyes?
    There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard says, “There is a lion in the road!
    There is a lion in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a door turns on its hinges,
    so does a sluggard on his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard buries his hand in the dish;
    it wears him out to bring it back to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes
    than seven men who can answer sensibly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever meddles in a quarrel not his own
    is like one who takes a passing dog by the ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a madman who throws firebrands, arrows, and death
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
is the man who deceives his neighbor
    and says, “I am only joking!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For lack of wood the fire goes out,
    and where there is no whisperer, quarreling ceases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As charcoal to hot embers and wood to fire,
    so is a quarrelsome man for kindling strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels;
    they go down into the inner parts of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the glaze covering an earthen vessel
    are fervent lips with an evil heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever hates disguises himself with his lips
    and harbors deceit in his heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he speaks graciously, believe him not,
    for there are seven abominations in his heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though his hatred be covered with deception,
    his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever digs a pit will fall into it,
    and a stone will come back on him who starts it rolling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lying tongue hates its victims,
    and a flattering mouth works ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not boast about tomorrow,
    for you do not know what a day may bring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let another praise you, and not your own mouth;
    a stranger, and not your own lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stone is heavy, and sand is weighty,
    but a fool's provocation is heavier than both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wrath is cruel, anger is overwhelming,
    but who can stand before jealousy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is open rebuke
    than hidden love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who is full loathes honey,
    but to one who is hungry everything bitter is sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a bird that strays from its nest
    is a man who strays from his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oil and perfume make the heart glad,
    and the sweetness of a friend comes from his earnest counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forsake your friend and your father's friend,
    and do not go to your brother's house in the day of your calamity.
Better is a neighbor who is near
    than a brother who is far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be wise, my son, and make my heart glad,
    that I may answer him who reproaches me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prudent sees danger and hides himself,
    but the simple go on and suffer for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take a man's garment when he has put up security for a stranger,
    and hold it in pledge when he puts up security for an adulteress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever blesses his neighbor with a loud voice,
    rising early in the morning,
    will be counted as cursing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A continual dripping on a rainy day
    and a quarrelsome wife are alike;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to restrain her is to restrain the wind
    or to grasp oil in one's right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iron sharpens iron,
    and one man sharpens another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever tends a fig tree will eat its fruit,
    and he who guards his master will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As in water face reflects face,
    so the heart of man reflects the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied,
    and never satisfied are the eyes of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crucible is for silver, and the furnace is for gold,
    and a man is tested by his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Crush a fool in a mortar with a pestle
    along with crushed grain,
    yet his folly will not depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Know well the condition of your flocks,
    and give attention to your herds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for riches do not last forever;
    and does a crown endure to all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the grass is gone and the new growth appears
    and the vegetation of the mountains is gathered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the lambs will provide your clothing,
    and the goats the price of a field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be enough goats' milk for your food,
    for the food of your household
    and maintenance for your girls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked flee when no one pursues,
    but the righteous are bold as a lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a land transgresses, it has many rulers,
    but with a man of understanding and knowledge,
    its stability will long continue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A poor man who oppresses the poor
    is a beating rain that leaves no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who forsake the law praise the wicked,
    but those who keep the law strive against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil men do not understand justice,
    but those who seek the Lord understand it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a poor man who walks in his integrity
    than a rich man who is crooked in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who keeps the law is a son with understanding,
    but a companion of gluttons shames his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever multiplies his wealth by interest and profit
    gathers it for him who is generous to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one turns away his ear from hearing the law,
    even his prayer is an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever misleads the upright into an evil way
    will fall into his own pit,
    but the blameless will have a goodly inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich man is wise in his own eyes,
    but a poor man who has understanding will find him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous triumph, there is great glory,
    but when the wicked rise, people hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever conceals his transgressions will not prosper,
    but he who confesses and forsakes them will obtain mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the one who fears the Lord always,
    but whoever hardens his heart will fall into calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a roaring lion or a charging bear
    is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A ruler who lacks understanding is a cruel oppressor,
    but he who hates unjust gain will prolong his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks in integrity will be delivered,
    but he who is crooked in his ways will suddenly fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever works his land will have plenty of bread,
    but he who follows worthless pursuits will have plenty of poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful man will abound with blessings,
    but whoever hastens to be rich will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To show partiality is not good,
    but for a piece of bread a man will do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stingy man hastens after wealth
    and does not know that poverty will come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever rebukes a man will afterward find more favor
    than he who flatters with his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever robs his father or his mother
    and says, “That is no transgression,”
    is a companion to a man who destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A greedy man stirs up strife,
    but the one who trusts in the Lord will be enriched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever trusts in his own mind is a fool,
    but he who walks in wisdom will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gives to the poor will not want,
    but he who hides his eyes will get many a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked rise, people hide themselves,
    but when they perish, the righteous increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is often reproved, yet stiffens his neck,
    will suddenly be broken beyond healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous increase, the people rejoice,
    but when the wicked rule, the people groan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves wisdom makes his father glad,
    but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By justice a king builds up the land,
    but he who exacts gifts tears it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who flatters his neighbor
    spreads a net for his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil man is ensnared in his transgression,
    but a righteous man sings and rejoices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man knows the rights of the poor;
    a wicked man does not understand such knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Scoffers set a city aflame,
    but the wise turn away wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a wise man has an argument with a fool,
    the fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bloodthirsty men hate one who is blameless
    and seek the life of the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a ruler listens to falsehood,
    all his officials will be wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man and the oppressor meet together;
    the Lord gives light to the eyes of both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a king faithfully judges the poor,
    his throne will be established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rod and reproof give wisdom,
    but a child left to himself brings shame to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked increase, transgression increases,
    but the righteous will look upon their downfall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discipline your son, and he will give you rest;
    he will give delight to your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no prophetic vision the people cast off restraint,
    but blessed is he who keeps the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By mere words a servant is not disciplined,
    for though he understands, he will not respond.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you see a man who is hasty in his words?
    There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever pampers his servant from childhood
    will in the end find him his heir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of wrath stirs up strife,
    and one given to anger causes much transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One's pride will bring him low,
    but he who is lowly in spirit will obtain honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The partner of a thief hates his own life;
    he hears the curse, but discloses nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of man lays a snare,
    but whoever trusts in the Lord is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many seek the face of a ruler,
    but it is from the Lord that a man gets justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous,
    but one whose way is straight is an abomination to the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I am too stupid to be a man.
    I have not the understanding of a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not learned wisdom,
    nor have I knowledge of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has ascended to heaven and come down?
    Who has gathered the wind in his fists?
Who has wrapped up the waters in a garment?
    Who has established all the ends of the earth?
What is his name, and what is his son's name?
    Surely you know!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every word of God proves true;
    he is a shield to those who take refuge in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not add to his words,
    lest he rebuke you and you be found a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Two things I ask of you;
    deny them not to me before I die:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
lest I be full and deny you
    and say, “Who is the Lord?”
or lest I be poor and steal
    and profane the name of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not slander a servant to his master,
    lest he curse you, and you be held guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are those who curse their fathers
    and do not bless their mothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are those who are clean in their own eyes
    but are not washed of their filth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are those—how lofty are their eyes,
    how high their eyelids lift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are those whose teeth are swords,
    whose fangs are knives,
to devour the poor from off the earth,
    the needy from among mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The leech has two daughters:
    Give and Give.
Three things are never satisfied;
    four never say, “Enough”:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol, the barren womb,
    the land never satisfied with water,
    and the fire that never says, “Enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye that mocks a father
    and scorns to obey a mother
will be picked out by the ravens of the valley
    and eaten by the vultures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Three things are too wonderful for me;
    four I do not understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the way of an eagle in the sky,
    the way of a serpent on a rock,
the way of a ship on the high seas,
    and the way of a man with a virgin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the way of an adulteress:
    she eats and wipes her mouth
    and says, “I have done no wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Under three things the earth trembles;
    under four it cannot bear up:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a slave when he becomes king,
    and a fool when he is filled with food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
an unloved woman when she gets a husband,
    and a maidservant when she displaces her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Four things on earth are small,
    but they are exceedingly wise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the ants are a people not strong,
    yet they provide their food in the summer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the rock badgers are a people not mighty,
    yet they make their homes in the cliffs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the locusts have no king,
    yet all of them march in rank;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the lizard you can take in your hands,
    yet it is in kings' palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Three things are stately in their tread;
    four are stately in their stride:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the lion, which is mightiest among beasts
    and does not turn back before any;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the strutting rooster, the he-goat,
    and a king whose army is with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have been foolish, exalting yourself,
    or if you have been devising evil,
    put your hand on your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For pressing milk produces curds,
    pressing the nose produces blood,
    and pressing anger produces strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of King Lemuel. An oracle that his mother taught him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What are you doing, my son? What are you doing, son of my womb?
    What are you doing, son of my vows?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not give your strength to women,
    your ways to those who destroy kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not for kings, O Lemuel,
    it is not for kings to drink wine,
    or for rulers to take strong drink,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest they drink and forget what has been decreed
    and pervert the rights of all the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give strong drink to the one who is perishing,
    and wine to those in bitter distress;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let them drink and forget their poverty
    and remember their misery no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your mouth for the mute,
    for the rights of all who are destitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your mouth, judge righteously,
    defend the rights of the poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An excellent wife who can find?
    She is far more precious than jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of her husband trusts in her,
    and he will have no lack of gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She does him good, and not harm,
    all the days of her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She seeks wool and flax,
    and works with willing hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is like the ships of the merchant;
    she brings her food from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She rises while it is yet night
    and provides food for her household
    and portions for her maidens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She considers a field and buys it;
    with the fruit of her hands she plants a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She dresses herself with strength
    and makes her arms strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She perceives that her merchandise is profitable.
    Her lamp does not go out at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She puts her hands to the distaff,
    and her hands hold the spindle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She opens her hand to the poor
    and reaches out her hands to the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is not afraid of snow for her household,
    for all her household are clothed in scarlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She makes bed coverings for herself;
    her clothing is fine linen and purple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her husband is known in the gates
    when he sits among the elders of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She makes linen garments and sells them;
    she delivers sashes to the merchant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strength and dignity are her clothing,
    and she laughs at the time to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She opens her mouth with wisdom,
    and the teaching of kindness is on her tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She looks well to the ways of her household
    and does not eat the bread of idleness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her children rise up and call her blessed;
    her husband also, and he praises her:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Many women have done excellently,
    but you surpass them all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Charm is deceitful, and beauty is vain,
    but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give her of the fruit of her hands,
    and let her works praise her in the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
